objects.name: About
objects.string:
Press left/right to control animation speed
Press Up/Down to switch display modes and show one layer at a time
Press A/B to change the map

objects.name: about2
objects.string: Multiple Tilemaps can be loaded, and tilemaps can be rotated/resized.

objects.name: about3
objects.string: Animation are supported, with some limitations: you have to put all the animated tiles on a row and there the speed of the tilemap animation must be set for the whole tilemap.

objects.name: about5
objects.string: The desert tilemap has compressed layer data (an option that can be enabled in Tiled). It also has spacing and margin on its atlas - all of this is supported.

objects.name: AboutAtlas
objects.string: These are the "atlas" images used by the tilemaps (shown here for educational purpose):

objects.name: PlatformerMapExplanation
objects.string: This is a Tilemap with rotated tiles, a feature that is also supported in GDevelop. It was made in LDtk level editor, then exported in Tiled map format to be opened in GDevelop.

objects.name: DragForMoreExplanation
objects.string: << Drag left or right for more >>

events.comment:
This is a demo and playground of what can be done with Tilemap objects.
Tilemap maps must be authored in a separated program, Tiled, that can be downloaded on mapeditor.org

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @ddabrahim
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: An action to move the camera by **dragging** with the mouse (or **scrolling** with the touch), on vertical, horizontal or both directions.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An action to move the camera by dragging with the mouse (or scrolling with the touch), on vertical, horizontal or both directions.

eventsFunctions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera _PARAM1_ on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ direction with the pointer

events.comment: when mouse button is pressed, get start position of mouse
when mouse button is pressed, get current position of mouse and calculate distance between the previous and current position on X and Y axis
if selected direction is horizontal or both
when mouse button is pressed, move camera on X axis
if direction is vertical or both
when mouse button is pressed, move camera on Y axis

parameters.description: Direction you want to drag the camera. It can be "vertical" or  "horizontal" or "both"
parameters.name: Direction
